title: Done
text: Hi there. I am required to put characters in.  Great place How does this help? Minimum of 150 characters. I think this is a forced review. I am not able to skip.

title: Great place to work
text: Freedom under responsibility is a good word for Dell. Great management and culture. Great setup for work from home opportunities. Colleagues and all the collaboration between departments.

title: Good and fun company
text: Dell treated people well with good paid and benefits. It could be stressful at a time, but most of time manageable. Most of managers are agreesive, which is what I like, but sometimes you feel the impact to the company is minimum since it is a really big company

title: Former Employee
text: I voluntarily left the company due to a very caustic, volatile and stressful environment.  While a Perot Systems Company, it was very well run until Dell took over as Dell Services.  Certain people were given plush assignments while others were often ignored and left to fend for themselves without proper motivation, counseling or mature management.

title: great place to learn and grow your career
text: awesome place to learn and has plenty of advancement opportunities (covid is affecting that, but let's be real its affecting every thing). People are allowed to be themselves and to question "why". Most in management help you get where you want to be and actually care about you as a person and they want people to succeed.

title: nothing
text: do not work there it was a waste of time, and i hate the company with all of my heart. i will never work for dell again. they are the pettiest company and they are prejudice

title: CYA culture sets up people to fail
text: Michael Dells culture of periodically cutting 10% of its workforce has lead to a company full of people who’s main function is to not get laid off. This is fine the first few generations to trim fat but after a while it reverses to a company where muscle is the first thing to burn off and stubborn fat is all that’s left.  A  rampant CYA boys club culture. By far the worst company I’ve ever worked at. Sadly I was warned and didn’t listen.

title: Great place to work
text: I loved working for Dell. It was a great atmosphere and everyone was pretty awesome. I would have stayed but had to move out of state   The managers were always easy going and liked helping with anything I needed

title: Senior leadership only care about themselves
text: I don't think Dell really cares about its employees. The senior leadership team especially doesn't care. There is also a HUGE lack of diversity at Dell, especially when it comes to lack of people of color in management roles. There is too much favoritism in senior management and most of the time, it's who you know. I don't think those in charge are honest, trustworthy and it's just a place where you never know from one day to the next, whether you will have a job. My direct manager was great, but his boss and the higher ups, are all about themselves and to me, very phony.

title: Great Company
text: I worked at Dell Technologies for 7 years as a software engineer. Loved my exprience at Dell! Received tuition reimbursment and good benefits. There are opportunities to grow.

title: Great work/life balance - too many mouths to feed
text: Work from home is great, but quotas are high and getting higher while the business itself is declining. They laid me off because I was more expensive to pay than the people on my team with a 2 designation instead of 3. Getting paid commission on 0.002% of each revenue dollar I booked also made it tough to get compensated well during this pandemic.

title: Loved the Flexibility
text: Great work-life balance. Dell provided flexibility both working hours and work from home (or anywhere). Great Culture as Dell... some initial tension & politics after integration with EMC, but still a great place to work.

title: Bad place to grow
text: Bad place, no career growth, too political and red tapes. Your added value will not matter soon. Once you are old then you are done. Benefits is mediocre at its best.

title: Great support and awesome work/life balance
text: Awesome work life/balance, working remotely is a huge plus and just an all around experience and team! Managers and supervisors are highly engaged and super supportive. On campus environment is a great experience as well!

title: Amazing Culture.
text: Literally nothing bad to say about Dell. Great pay, great benefits, amazing people. I was happy to go to work pretty much everyday. There is so much to learn but if you take the time you can make alot of money.

title: Stodgy, risk averse, HR-run company
text: Work here long enough, and you’ll get brain constipation. They will suck the will to live out of you. Job promotions and advancements are often delayed. This company is a conglomeration of micro-managers. They have no leadership.  Stay for a year; get some good experience, and then go to a competitor that is willing to pay you what you’re really worth. I did.

title: No Work/Life Balance
text: No Work/Life Balance, no Job Security. Worst Management and work Culture is also pathetic. Overall it's a mixed experience working here. It's not about Company, it's about your current leaders you work with.

title: Great company to start career with and move on...
text: Great company to start career with and then move on to gain more experience. The raw number of employees that surround you can be overwhelming, Everyone is competetive in sales and quotas are attentainable but 100% was not good enough - 110% is expected. This may have changed in the past decaded. When I was there, the one who stayed at his desk the longest, answered the most inbound calls, and returned the most quote calls in follow would win. This usually meant the single people who worked long hours could were ahead of married with children. So hence, get in young, impress while young and interview as often as possible so you know the expections to succeed.

title: Great culture and great work environment
text: At Dell technologies I was very involved with the culture and loved the sales atmosphere. i would highly recommend working at Dell Technologies for any new or experienced sales person.

title: Dell
text: Great company, love the pay and the hours, great benefits, you will love to work for Dell it is awesome, again I would just like to submit this butvI can't until I reach 150 characters
